posts.name: CJ Hill
posts.cooked: An algae sample we received has a small hole preventing it from holding air effectively. Sealing such gaps can be tricky. While I considered using green slime sealant via a hypodermic needle to fill around the hole, letting gravity direct it, I wonder if there are more effective methods available. Any suggestions would be helpful!

link_counts.title: Amazon.com : Slime 10003 Bike Tube Puncture Repair Sealant, Prevent and Repair, suitable for all Bicycles, Non-Toxic, Eco-Friendly, 8oz bottle : Automotive Paint Sealers And Protectants : Sports & Outdoors

posts.name: Garrison
posts.cooked: We punctured our bike while inserting the inflation needle and used a bike tire patch kit that a mentor had at home. It‚Äôs holding air well after lots of glue and about 10 minutes of letting it set while holding the patch on. It held air for at least 5 hours without noticeable deflation. Hoping it just holds up indefinitely.

posts.name: kauree bellüíô‚ù§Ô∏è
posts.cooked: This isn‚Äôt the first time I‚Äôve heard of algae causing issues in the KOPs. I‚Äôve seen holes, and I‚Äôm sure you have too. I‚Äôve heard of bike tire patches being useful‚Äîlike rubber cement, which is our go-to this season. When I looked into past discussions on Chief Delphi, people often used tire patch kits or vinyl patches. While the specifics might differ, I think one or a mix of those materials would work well for fixing practice equipment.

posts.name: Sam R
posts.cooked: Unless I'm overlooking it in the First Dashboard, this isn't one you can replace through the website. One of ours has a small hole too. I'll check the email address they provided and get in touch.
Extremely important note: Many people have experienced this issue with their Algae. One of our Algae balls has a small hole.
A ours popped the first time someone tossed it (ending up on a screw). A small activator and superglue were sufficient.

posts.name: Amicus1
posts.cooked: One of ours has a hole as well.
Does anyone think robots could impact game strategies if the ball can get into holes?

posts.name: Jeremiah Johnson
posts.cooked: Being extra vigilant about sharp edges on your robot this year will be important.

posts.name: Robertson Robotics
posts.cooked: Has anyone official mentioned whether we can request a replacement Algae? I also reached out via email but haven‚Äôt received a response yet. Our Substitute Kit Container dropdown currently shows only 'Please Select' with no available options.

posts.name: GaryVoshol
posts.cooked: An ARENA fault is not called for matches that begin with damaged SCORING ELEMENTS. Damaged SCORING ELEMENTS are not replaced until the next ARENA reset period. DRIVE TEAMS should alert FIELD STAFF to any missing or damaged SCORING ELEMENTS prior to the start of the match.

posts.name: Robertson Robotics
posts.cooked: request a replacement for damaged algae you received in the Kit of Parts, not during the competition

posts.name: Sam R
posts.cooked: I got a response from them, but I also went on the site and the equations are now listed under "Loose" in the dropdown.

posts.name: Robertson Robotics
posts.cooked: Same here. Thanks to the FIRST Robotics Competition Parts people who need to get back in touch!

posts.name: Mr. Rip
posts.cooked: As the season progressed, I attempted to address significant algae patches using a patch kit for bicycle tires. The instructions emphasized roughing up the surface beforehand, a necessity given the ridges on the algae‚Äôs outer surface. I utilized a rotary tool as indicated. Subsequently, I successfully repaired the algae with no signs of leakage, even when holes were challenging to locate.
